issue.title: Implements #2734 “New API to configure BrowserWindow title bar on Mac”

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body: New API supported on Yosemite 10.10 and newer. Two new title bar styles: ``` window = new BrowserWindow({width: 600, height: 400, 'title-bar-style': 'hidden'}); ``` ``` window = new BrowserWindow({width: 600, height: 400, 'title-bar-style': 'hidden-inset'}); ```

rename.from: BrowserWindow `title-bar-style': 'hidden-inset'` option causes crash on OS X 10.9
rename.to: BrowserWindow 'title-bar-style': 'hidden-inset' option causes crash on OS X 10.9

body: I see the issue on OS X 10.10.5 too.

This is strange. I now reviewed and tested the Chromium implementation of `IsOSYosemiteOrLater` and it looks correct. It should guard against that method running. @sindresorhus and @ssreekanth what does `uname -r` (from command line) return on your Mavericks system?
@ssreekanth so what exactly do you see on your 10.10.5 Yosemite machine? These APIs should be available there.

About the comment made by @zcbenz …

> Can you create a new issue for this? I'm wondering if it is caused by me setting `MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET` to `10.10`.

I’m now looking at `vendor/brightray/vendor/download/libchromiumcontent/src/base/mac_util.h` which says…

```
// When the deployment target is set, the code produced cannot run on earlier
// OS releases. That enables some of the IsOS* family to be implemented as
// constant-value inline functions. The MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED macro
// contains the value of the deployment target.
```

And the inlined function is…

```
#if defined(MAC_OS_X_VERSION_10_10) && \
    MAC_OS_X_VERSION_MIN_REQUIRED >= MAC_OS_X_VERSION_10_10
#define BASE_MAC_MAC_UTIL_H_INLINED_GE_10_10
inline bool IsOSYosemiteOrLater() { return true; }
#endif
```

I’m not sure how to set a deployment target for building this project to test this theory, but it appears that if this inlined function were to be used, it would produce incorrect results when code built on Yosemite is run on pre-Yosemite.
@jaanus I just published my [app](https://github.com/sindresorhus/caprine) if you need a testcase.

issue.title: Support older OS X versions
issue.body: Currently only OS X 10.10 and newer is supported because of https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/2790.
